Package ru.nsu.fit.smolyakov.substring_finder

Class CharSlicer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.nsu.fit.smolyakov.substring_finder.CharSlicer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Character>
    public class CharSlicer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Character>
    The CharSlicer class provides a fixed-size buffered sliding window over a supplied text. Creation of a slice of a length greater than the whole text length will be interrupted by an InputMismatchException. The user is supposed to destructively assign a return value of a shift(int) method to the current class instance, as it indicates if the stream is over. If the user tries to use get(int), iterator() or toCharArray() from a slice doesn't containing a specified amount of characters, an IllegalStateException will be thrown.

                  int sliceLength)
           throws java.io.IOException,
                  java.util.InputMismatchException
        Constructs a new CharSlicer instance with a specified InputStreamReader and sliceLength.
        Parameters:
        source - an input stream reader
        sliceLength - a length of this slice
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if source is unavailable
        java.util.InputMismatchException - if source contains less than sliceLength characters
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if sliceLength is non-positive

        Returns:

      • toCharArray

        public char[] toCharArray()
        Converts this CharSlicer to a new character array.
        Returns:
        a newly allocated character array whose length is the length of this slice and whose contents are initialized to contain the character sequence represented by this CharSlicer instance
        Throws:
